Pre-Game Insights: The Toronto Blue Jays and the Boston Red Sox meet Thursday in MLB action from Fenway Park.
This will be the final installment in a four-game series.
The Blue Jays played the Los Angeles Angels in a long weekend series and swept those four games.
The Jays split the first two outings versus the Red Sox 7-3 (win) and 6-3 (loss).
On Wednesday Toronto took a shutout loss 3-0 with just two team hits.
In the starter role for the Jays on Thursday it’ll be Bowden Francis, who is 7-3 with a 4.02 ERA in 22 games (eight starts) this year.
Over on the Red Sox’ side, they were swept by the Arizona Diamondbacks in their weekend series with losses 12-2, 4-1 and 7-5.
On Wednesday Boston scored twice in the bottom of the eighth to cap off the win.
Kutter Crawford will start for the Red Sox on Thursday. So far Crawford is 8-11 with a 4.19 ERA in 27 starts.
Five of the Blue Jays' last six games as road underdogs have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Four of the Red Sox's last five games against American League opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Masataka Yoshida has recorded at least one Single in each of the Red Sox's last five night games against AL opponents that held a losing record.
Jarren Duran has scored at least one run in each of the Red Sox's last six night games.
Jarren Duran has recorded at least one RBI in four of the Red Sox's last five games as favorites against AL East opponents.
Masataka Yoshida has recorded at least one total base in each of the Red Sox's last 13 games against the Blue Jays at Fenway Park.
Jarren Duran has hit a home run in three of the Red Sox's last four games as favorites.
Masataka Yoshida has recorded at least one hit in each of the Red Sox's last 13 games against the Blue Jays at Fenway Park.
Ernie Clement has recorded at least one RBI in seven of his last nine appearances in night games.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. has recorded at least one total base in each of the Blue Jays' last 22 games against AL East opponents that held a winning record.
George Springer has hit a home run in three of the Blue Jays' last five games against the Red Sox.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. has recorded at least one hit in each of the Blue Jays' last 22 games against AL East opponents that held a winning record.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. has recorded a Double in six of the Blue Jays' last eight road games against AL East opponents.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. has recorded at least one Single in seven of the Blue Jays' last eight night games against AL East opponents that held a winning record.
